intro: Lavatera calicina, commonly known as the silverleaf lavatera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces showy, fluffy flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in summer. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Lavatera calicina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
